item.title: Provision libvirt Multiple VM with Terraform/Opentofu
item.description:
Provision libvirt Multiple VM with Terraform/Opentofu

Background

In this post we’ll be using libvirt provisioner with Terraform/Opentofu to deploy mulitple KVM Virtual Machine.

Table of Contents

  1. Dependencies
  2. Add Permission to user
  3. Terraform init
  4. Variable and Config
  5. Terraform plan
  6. Terraform apply
  7. Verify VM

Install Dependencies

sudo dnf install libvirt virt-install virsh -y

# enable and start libvirtd service
sudo systemctl enable --now libvirtd

Verify if the host is can now run guest machine.

item.title: Automate VM Provisition with Terraform or Opentofu
item.description:
Automate VM Provisition with Terraform or Opentofu

Background

Been using Terraform/Opentofu when I moved my homelab to dedicated server (old laptop and PC), previously from a bunch of Raspberry Pi. Using this technology has made my learning in DevOps more optimal or faster.

With recent announcement of Hashicorp to change Terraform’s opensource licence to a propriety licence, we’ll be using Opentofu (just my preference, command will still be relatively similar).
